description: Got in a nice and easy Sunday ride in a pretty empty Downtown St Louis. Aside from a light crowd around Busch Stadium for a long rain-delayed game, the city was a ghosttown. I got to ride around the Arch, watch some of the game from outside sitting on my bike, ride the warf, Union Station. Nice little ride.
Cool little ride in a cool little Oklahoma town

Awesome early morning ride. Old Colorado Springs. Manitou Springs. Garden of the Gods. I could ride around there all day. Highlight...I rode across a fun little bike resort. Might be a fun place for a future stay.
BUCKET LIST RIDE!!! I've been riding this route via a video on my Peleton for years. Today, I finally got to actually ride it and IT. WAS. AWESOME.
A festive 4th of July ride around a cool mountain resort town that incuded a little more climbing than I expected and ended with a drove show. I still prefer firewors, but it was a cool day.
So many fantastic views!

I've been wanting to ride Mah Dah Hey for a long time and it did not disappoint. I followed a trip I mapped at on Komoot. At want point, the map took me to what i thought would be a bridge a bridge across the Little Missouri River. When I got there...no bridge. It was close to dark and riding back the way I cam would have added about 10 miles, so I took off my boots, tied them around my neck and swam my bile across the river. Loved every minute of it.

Another bucket list ride in the bag. I want later in the day after a rain storm and the road was surprisingly quiet. The ride up was incredible. On the way back down, I stopped to take a picture of one of the tunnels. As I was putting my phone back on my bike, I saw a cougar peak it's head thru the tunnel. Ughhhh! I waited for a car to drive the tunnel before I built up the nerve to do it myself.

Souix Falls is one of my faovrite towns. There are great paths to ride and always tons to see. The falls are incredible and I'll ride there any chance I get. It reminds me a lot of Richmond bult around the James River.
I lived in Virginia Beach a couple summers in college and I always love going back. tons of great places to ride. It's changes soooo much since my day.
I spent a long weekend biking around Estes Park and Rocky Mountain NP. I could spend years. The views are amazing, the climbs are incredible, and the trails are endles.
Jekyll Isand has become one of my favorite stops down I95. The ride is flat and supre relaxing, but the views are 100% worth it.
Great rides in Punta Gorda. Fantastic way to bring in spring.
A quick stop on the way further south in Florida, but a nice early morning ride with a palm tree view.
First time in Florence. The downtown is pretty cool. The ride from outside of town to downtown was kinda boring.
A half dozen great rides during a long weekend in Duck. YAY!
Frederick is a cool twon. Any ride around here that allows me to run thru dwontown is a win.
Harpers Ferry is a bike riders paradise.
While we were climbing the mountain to Lake Moriaine, I couldn't stop saying "Hell yes" outloud.,
Took my foldable bile on a cruise. Took it off for a great ride in San Juan.
BUCKET LIST RIDE!!! Never in my life did I think I'd ride a bicycle in Alaska.
BUCKET LIST RIDE!!! I just have 2 words to say...The Goonies!
BUCKET LIST RIDE!!! Thru Springdale, into Zion, Up and down the switchbacks to the tunnel, along the Virgin River to the top of the climb. Every second of this ride was jaw dropping.
BUCKET LIST RIDE!!!! I. RODE. THE. FLORIDA. KEYS!!!

BUCKET LIST WEEK!!!! I rented a camper van and a bike and followed the Giro D'Italia around for 7 days. I visited Lake Como, tayed in a vineyard in the Piedmont and rode some of the coolest roures I've ever ridden!!!
BUCKET LIST WEEK!!!! This was the week Peter Segan rode the Worlds in my hometown! AWESOME!!!!!
